biotechnology to introduce new traits or characteristics.", 'Marker-assisted selection (MAS): Using genetic markers to identify individuals with desirable traits and selectively breeding them.', 'Quantitative trait locus (QTL) mapping: Identifying the location of genes responsible for specific traits or characteristics and using this information to improve breeding programs.', "Genome-wide association studies (GWAS): Analyzing an individual's entire genome to identify genetic variations associated with specific traits or characteristics.", 'Next-generation sequencing (NGS):
